phishing_click.title: Phishing Click Response
immediate_actions: Do NOT enter any credentials on the phishing site
Change passwords for all accounts immediately
Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) on all accounts
Scan your device with antivirus software

priority_steps.title: Secure Your Accounts
actions: Change passwords for email, banking, and social media accounts
Enable 2FA on all critical accounts
Check for unauthorized access in account activity logs
Contact your bank if financial information was entered

priority_steps.title: Scan and Clean Device
actions: Run full antivirus scan
Check for malware or keyloggers
Update all software and security patches
Clear browser cache and cookies

priority_steps.title: Report the Incident
actions: Report to your IT department (if work device)
Report to anti-phishing organizations
Forward phishing email to reportphishing@apwg.org
Report to FTC at reportfraud.ftc.gov

priority_steps.title: Monitor for Identity Theft
actions: Monitor bank and credit card statements
Check credit reports for suspicious activity
Set up fraud alerts with credit bureaus
Watch for suspicious emails or calls

evidence_checklist: List of accounts that may be compromised
Browser history showing the phishing link

brand_impersonation.title: Brand Impersonation Response
immediate_actions: Do NOT click any links or download attachments
Verify the sender's email address carefully
Check official company website for legitimate contact
Do NOT provide any personal or financial information
Report the impersonation to the legitimate brand

priority_steps.title: Verify Legitimacy
actions: Check sender's email address for typos or suspicious domains
Visit the official company website directly (not via link)
Contact the company through official channels
Compare the message with previous legitimate communications

priority_steps.title: Document the Impersonation
actions: Take screenshots of the impersonation
Save email headers and full message
Note the date, time, and platform where seen
Document any phone numbers or contact methods used

priority_steps.title: Report to Authorities
actions: Report to the impersonated brand's security team
Report to FTC at reportfraud.ftc.gov
Report to IC3 (Internet Crime Complaint Center)
Report to your local law enforcement if financial loss occurred

priority_steps.title: Protect Yourself and Others
actions: Warn friends and family about the scam
Report on social media platforms if applicable
Check if you've already been compromised
Review your accounts for suspicious activity

evidence_checklist: Fake phone number or contact information
Any links or attachments (do not click)

data_leak.title: Data Leak Response
immediate_actions: Change passwords for affected accounts immediately
Enable 2FA on all accounts, especially affected ones
Check what data was leaked (email, password, credit card, etc.)
Contact your bank if financial data was exposed
Freeze your credit reports with all three bureaus

priority_steps.title: Assess the Damage
actions: Determine what type of data was leaked
Check if passwords were hashed or in plain text
Identify all affected accounts and services
Review the scope of personal information exposed

priority_steps.title: Secure Your Accounts
actions: Change passwords for all affected accounts
Use unique, strong passwords for each account
Enable 2FA wherever possible
Review and revoke suspicious app permissions

priority_steps.title: Protect Financial Information
actions: Contact banks and credit card companies
Request new card numbers if cards were exposed
Set up fraud alerts with credit bureaus
Consider placing a credit freeze

priority_steps.title: Monitor and Report
actions: Monitor bank and credit card statements regularly
Check credit reports monthly for suspicious activity
Report to FTC at identitytheft.gov
Consider identity theft protection service

priority_steps.title: Legal and Compliance
actions: Report to relevant data protection authorities
Document all steps taken in response
Keep records of any financial losses
Consult with legal counsel if significant data exposed

evidence_checklist: List of affected accounts and services
Type of data leaked (emails, passwords, SSN, etc.)
